Identification.ShortTitle: Non-residents’ Temporary Importation of Baggage and Conveyances Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Temporary Importation of Baggage and Conveyances by a Person Not a Resident of Canada

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of National Revenue, pursuant to tariff item 70305-1* of Schedule A to the Customs Tariff, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations respecting the temporary importation of baggage and conveyances by a person not a resident of Canada.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Non-residents’ Temporary Importation of Baggage and Conveyances Regulations.

Definition.Text: baggage means the baggage referred to in section 4; (bagages)
beer means beer or malt liquor as defined in section 4 of the Excise Act; (bière)
cigar has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Excise Act, 2001; (cigare)
cigarette has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Excise Act, 2001; (cigarette)
common-law partner, in respect of a person, means an individual who is the common-law partner of the per-son within the meaning of subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act; (conjoint de fait)

conveyance means any vehicle, aircraft, water-borne craft or other contrivance that is used to move persons or goods but does not include a mobile home trailer that is more than 2.6 metres in width; (moyen de transport)
manufactured tobacco has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Excise Act, 2001; (tabac fabriqué)
Minister means the Minister of National Revenue; (ministre)
resident means a person who, in the settled routine of that person’s life, makes their home, resides and is or-dinarily present in Canada; (résident)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is not a resident of Canada and who resides temporarily in Canada for the purpose of

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: employment for a period not exceeding 36 months, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: performing preclearance activities on behalf of the Government of the United States under the terms of the Agreement on Air Transport Preclearance between the Government of Canada and the Government of the United States of America, signed January 18, 2001,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the spouse or common-law partner or any dependant of a person described in subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii), and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the spouse or common-law partner or any dependant of a person described in subparagraph (a)(iii); (résident temporaire)

Definition.Text: visitor means a person who is not a resident or a temporary resident and who enters Canada for a period not exceeding 12 months. (visiteur)

Section.Text: A person who is not a resident may import baggage or conveyances classified under tariff item No. 9803.00.00 for the personal use of that person in Canada if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the baggage or conveyances are not used by a resident;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of conveyances, they are not used in Canada for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: moving passengers or goods for compensation or for transporting goods for sale, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: soliciting sales or subscriptions on behalf of the Canadian office of a business or on behalf of a business based in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of consumable goods

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that are imported by a person described in subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii) or paragraph (b) of the definition temporary resident in section 2, they accompany that person at the time when that person initially arrives in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that are imported by any other temporary resident, they accompany the temporary resident at the time that temporary resident initially arrives in Canada or at any time that that temporary resident returns to Canada after an absence abroad, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: that are imported by a person other than a temporary resident, they accompany that person at the time the person arrives in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where the baggage or conveyances are imported by a visitor, the visitor declares that the visitor intends

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to leave Canada on a specified date, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to make a series of visits to Canada within the succeeding 12 months and specifies the date on which the visitor intends to leave Canada at the end of the final visit of the visitor;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of baggage or conveyances other than consumable goods, the baggage or conveyances are exported from Canada or destroyed under the supervision of a customs officer before the expiration of the time limit specified in section 5; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a visitor referred to in subparagraph (e)(ii), the visitor produces, on each arrival in Canada during the period referred to in that subparagraph, the customs form issued to the visitor in respect of any baggage or conveyances that were imported on a previous visit and remained in Canada during the visitor’s absence if the visitor is requested by a customs officer to do so.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the baggage that a person who is not a resident of Canada may temporarily import under tariff item No. 9803.00.00 consists of any goods that the person imports for their personal use and that are appropriate for their needs and consistent with the purpose, nature and duration of their intended stay in Canada, but does not include more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 1.5 L of wine, or 1.14 L of spirits, or 1.14 L of wine and spirits, or 8.5 L of beer or ale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 200 cigarettes, 50 cigars, 200 g of manufactured tobacco and 200 tobacco sticks; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 200 rounds of ammunition or, if they are for the use of that person at a meet held under the auspices of a recognized shooting or rifle association of Canada, 1,500 rounds of ammunition.

Subsection.Text: If a person described in subparagraph (a)(iii) or paragraph (c) of the definition temporary resident in section 2 has been absent from Canada for not less than 48 hours, the baggage that that person may import under tariff item No. 9803.00.00 does not include alcoholic beverages or tobacco products.
Imported baggage and conveyances classified under tariff item No. 9803.00.00 may remain in Canada

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where they are imported by a visitor, until the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration of the date that the visitor has declared, under subparagraph 3(e)(i) or (ii), the visitor intends to leave Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 months after the date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they are imported by a person described in subparagraph (a)(i) of the definition temporary resident in section 2, or by the spouse, common-law partner or dependant of that person, until the day on which that person completes their studies at an educational institution;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if they are imported by a person described in subparagraph (a)(ii) of the definition temporary resident in section 2, or by the spouse, common-law partner or dependant of that person, until the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which that person completes their employment in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 36 months after the day on which that person arrives in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if they are imported by a person described in subparagraph (a)(iii) or paragraph (c) of the definition temporary resident in section 2, until the day on which the person described in subparagraph (a)(iii) completes their employment in Canada with the Government of the United States.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), where it is impossible or impracticable for a visitor or temporary resident to comply with the requirements of that subsection, the Minister may extend the length of time during which any imported baggage or conveyances that are classified under tariff item No. 9803.00.00 may remain in Canada

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of baggage or conveyances imported by a visitor, to any date up to 18 months after the date of importation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of baggage or conveyances imported by a temporary resident, to any date up to six months after the termination of his employment or studies, as the case may be, in Canada.

Section.Text: The Minister may require security, in the form of cash or a certified cheque, in respect of any baggage or conveyances imported and classified under tariff item No. 9803.00.00 of the Customs Tariff in an amount not exceeding the duties that would be payable if that tariff item did not apply.
